ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
cookingMethod: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic, parsley, salt, and black pepper.
Add the shrimp to the bowl and toss to coat well.
Thread the shrimp onto skewers.
Grill the skewers for 2-3 minutes per side, or until the shrimp are pink and slightly charred.
Remove the skewers from the grill and squeeze fresh lemon juice over the top.
Serve hot.
Arrange the tomato and mozzarella slices on a platter, alternating between the two.
Tuck the fresh basil leaves in between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
In a small bowl, whisk together the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt, and black pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the top of the salad.
Serve immediately.
In a large saucepan, bring the broth to a simmer.
In a separate large saucepan or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
Add the onion and garlic and sauté until softened.
Add the rice and stir to coat with the oil, onions, and garlic. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Add the white wine and stir until it is absorbed into the rice.
Add 1/2 cup of the simmering broth to the rice and stir until it is absorbed.
Continue adding broth to the rice, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring frequently and waiting for each addition to be absorbed before adding the next.
When the rice is tender and creamy but still slightly firm to the bite, stir in the mushrooms and spinach.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, until the spinach is wilted and the mushrooms are tender.
Remove from heat and stir in the Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 red bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces
1 green bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1-inch pieces
cookingMethod: In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Add the chicken pieces to the marinade and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours.
Preheat a grill or grill pan to medium-high heat.
Thread the marinated chicken, bell peppers, onion, and mushrooms onto skewers, alternating the ingredients as desired.
Grill the kabobs for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender and slightly charred.
Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 lb beef tenderloin, sliced into strips
cookingMethod: Season the beef strips with salt and pepper.
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the beef strips in butter for 3-5 minutes.
Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, sauté the onion, garlic, and mushrooms until tender.
Add the flour to the skillet and stir to combine.
Gradually add the beef broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Bring the mixture to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
Stir in the sour cream and return the beef strips to the skillet.
Heat the beef stroganoff until hot and serve over cooked egg noodles.

ingredients: 1 lb. large shrimp, peeled and deveined
cookingMethod: Cook the linguine according to the package directions.
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter.
Add the garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and sauté for 2-3 minutes, or until cooked through.
Remove the shrimp from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the white wine, chicken broth, lemon juice, parsley, and red pepper flakes.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Season the sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Add the cooked linguine to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce.
Add the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to combine.
Top with grated Parmesan cheese and serve.

ingredients: 1 large butternut squash, peeled, seeded, and chopped
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place the chopped butternut squash on a large baking sheet and drizzle with the olive oil. Toss to coat evenly.
Roast in the oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the squash is tender and caramelized.
In a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat, sauté the onion and garlic until tender and fragrant.
Add the roasted butternut squash, chicken broth, dried thyme, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, salt, and black pepper to the pot.
Stir well to combine and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the flavors have melded together and the soup is hot and bubbly.
Remove the soup from the heat and let it cool slightly.
Puree the soup in batches in a blender or food processor until smooth.
Return the soup to the pot and stir in the heavy cream.
Heat the soup over medium heat until hot and serve.
Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger, and garlic
Grill chicken until browned
Sauté onions and spices in a pan
Add tomatoes and cook until soft
Add grilled chicken to the pan and simmer until cooked through

ingredients: 6 bell peppers, tops removed and seeded
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef, onion, and garlic until the beef is no longer pink and the onion is tender.
Drain any excess fat.
Add the cooked rice, diced tomatoes, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper to the skillet.
Stir until well combined and heated through.
Stuff each bell pepper with the beef and rice mixture.
Place the stuffed bell peppers in a large baking dish.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is hot and bubbly.
Sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the top of the stuffed peppers and return to the oven.
Bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot.

recipeName: Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Dill
cookingMethod: Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, honey, chopped dill, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the marinade, making sure to coat them evenly.
Place the salmon fillets on the grill, skin-side down.
Grill for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with fresh lemon slices and serve hot.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped potatoes, carrots, onion, and minced garlic.
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Toss the vegetables until evenly coated with the seasonings.
Transfer the seasoned vegetables to a large baking dish.
Place the chicken breasts on top of the vegetables.
Drizzle the chicken with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake for 35-40 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the vegetables are tender.
Serve hot.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce, sliced cucumber, chopped tomato, and thinly sliced red onion.
Add the Kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss until evenly coated.
Serve immediately.

ingredients: 2 lbs. russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
1/2 cup unsalted butter, cut into cubes
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place the cubed potatoes and minced garlic on a baking sheet.
Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Roast for 30-35 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and lightly browned.
Transfer the roasted potatoes and garlic to a large mixing bowl.
Add the butter and milk and mash the mixture with a potato masher until smooth and creamy.
Season with additional salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.
Cook the spaghetti according to the package directions until al dente.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook the pancetta over medium heat until crisp.
Add the minced garlic and sauté for an additional minute.
In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and grated Parmesan cheese.
Once the spaghetti is cooked, reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water and drain the rest.
Add the spaghetti to the skillet with the pancetta and garlic, and toss to combine.
Remove the skillet from the heat and pour in the egg yolk mixture, tossing the spaghetti until coated.
If the sauce is too thick, add a little bit of the reserved pasta water to thin it out.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the egg and vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt.
Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture and stir until well combined.
Fold in the chocolate chips and chopped walnuts, if using.
Drop spoonfuls of dough onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Serve warm or at room temperature.
Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
In a large skillet, cook the pancetta over medium heat until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together the egg yolks, Parmesan cheese, and heavy cream.
When the spaghetti is done, reserve 1 cup of the pasta water and drain the rest.
Add the spaghetti to the skillet with the pancetta and toss to coat.
Remove the skillet from the heat and add the egg mixture, stirring constantly to avoid curdling.
Add pasta water as needed to thin the sauce.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and beef broth.
In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over high heat.
Add the beef to the skillet and cook until browned.
Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
Add the onion, bell peppers, snow peas, garlic, and ginger to the skillet and stir-fry until tender.
Return the beef to the skillet and add the soy sauce mixture.
Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce has thickened and the beef is cooked through.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup kalamata olives, pitted and halved
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, oregano, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour the olive oil mixture over the top, turning to coat evenly.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
Remove the chicken from the oven and sprinkle with the cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives, feta cheese, and chopped parsley.
Return the chicken to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot with a side salad or roasted vegetables.
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a small bowl, mix together the chopped spinach, crumbled feta cheese, chopped sun-dried tomatoes, minced garlic, salt, and pepper.
Using a sharp knife, cut a pocket into each chicken breast.
Divide the spinach and feta mixture evenly among the chicken breasts, stuffing it into the pockets.
Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the stuffed chicken breasts to the skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.
Transfer the chicken breasts to a baking dish and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center.
Serve hot with a side salad or roasted vegetables.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the chopped romaine lettuce, sliced cucumber, chopped tomato, and thinly sliced red onion.
Add the Kalamata olives and crumbled feta cheese.
In a small mixing bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red wine vinegar, dried oregano, salt, and pepper.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss until evenly coated.
Serve immediately.
